prefix: Approach the following question the way someone with a PhD in engineering would.
problem_prompt:
Approach the following question the way someone with a PhD in engineering would. What is the SMILES expression of nitroxyl;1,3-thiazole?
Answer:
gpt_response:
The SMILES expression of nitroxyl;1,3-thiazole is [O-][N+](=O)1C=CSH1. 

In this SMILES notation, [O-][N+](=O) represents the nitroxyl group, which consists of a nitrogen atom with a single oxygen atom and a double-bonded oxygen atom. The semicolon ";" is used to separate the nitroxyl group from the rest of the molecule, which in this case is 1,3-thiazole. Thiazole is a five-membered heterocyclic ring containing one sulfur atom and one nitrogen atom. The "C=C" denotes the double bond between the carbon and sulfur atoms in position 2 and 3 of the thiazole ring, respectively. The "SH1" indicates a sulfur atom with a hydrogen atom attached at position 1 of the thiazole ring.
solution_prompt:
The following is a response to a question. Yes or no, is the final solution obtained in the following response ['C1=CSC=N1.N=O']?: The SMILES expression of nitroxyl;1,3-thiazole is [O-][N+](=O)1C=CSH1. 

In this SMILES notation, [O-][N+](=O) represents the nitroxyl group, which consists of a nitrogen atom with a single oxygen atom and a double-bonded oxygen atom. The semicolon ";" is used to separate the nitroxyl group from the rest of the molecule, which in this case is 1,3-thiazole. Thiazole is a five-membered heterocyclic ring containing one sulfur atom and one nitrogen atom. The "C=C" denotes the double bond between the carbon and sulfur atoms in position 2 and 3 of the thiazole ring, respectively. The "SH1" indicates a sulfur atom with a hydrogen atom attached at position 1 of the thiazole ring.
gpt_response_correct_incorrect: No, the final solution obtained is not ['C1=CSC=N1.N=O']. The SMILES notation provided is [O-][N+](=O)1C=CSH1 which represents nitroxyl;1,3-thiazole.
